job_title: State Tested Nursing Assistant in Springfield, OH
pros: The Masonic Home has been part of the community decades. If someone walks through the tunnel, history appears in pictures of Masons who lived there.
cons: There are no more "cons" at the Masonic Home than other well-run facilities.

pros: I love the residents they are all so cute.
cons: They don't take care of their employees. Rather pay agency $35 an hour instead of paying their employees the money or better bonuses. They don't like to work with the schedule you may need. PRN don't get paid anything, $12 ISN'T ENOUGH TO LIVE.

pros:

review_title: It's all about your money now
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Springfield, OH
pros: Some really hard working shift supervisors.  Some good nurses and aids who are working their fingers to the bone trying to provide competent care.
cons: Where do I start. Absolutely horrible management. The Masons seem to have gotten away from their core beliefs and now only focus on money. We have actually been told they want out of the long term care business because there's no enough money in it anymore. They now want to cater to assisted living residents.  Nurses jobs are being cut or even used as aides, due to the inability to keep aides. I have seen some really good nurses lose their jobs due to new management. Most of the nurses left are older and have been there for decades and are afraid to leave.  They are all jealous of each other and at each others throats afraid they could lose their job while another would keep their job. In addition, employee benefits have been slashed. Ever heard of a $10,000 deductible for health care, that you pay for every week through your paycheck?  If I or a family member get sick, I essentially take a $10,000 pay cut. If they really need to save money, cut the fat from management, not the people providing care.

review_title: Loved my coworkers, executives a joke
job_title: Home Care Billing in Springfield, OH
pros:
Decent pay if you work at the corporate level
Decent benefits
Beautiful facility
Wonderful staff
Multiple opportunities within the company for growth
cons:
Archaic management. 
Consistent executive level turnover means consistently stagnant company. Lack of bonus/incentives.  
Employees are not recognized for achievements not add their opinions respected

review_title: I have been with this company 31/2 years now and seen a lot of changes in such a short time !
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Springfield, OH
cons: This place is such drama, if people would focus on taking care of the residents and stay out of everyone's business, it might run more smoothly ! Everyone there is back stabbing and don"t trust no one ! They give you PTO time ha try and find someone to cover you if possible, or you won"t be receiving a day off !!!

pros: The Home is filled with employees that want to make a difference to their residents and the families.  Decent wages as compared with the industry and benefits are pretty good.  403 (b) with up to a 4% match is great.  Overall, it is a great place to work.
cons: The culture that they want sometimes gets lost in management.

pros: People who love what they do.  Residents are wonderful. Beautiful campus. Company constantly trying to find great benefits for employees.  Open communication is encouraged.
cons: Staffing, but that is everywhere these days.
